snippet: A virus deadly only to young pigs, with no danger for humans, appeared in the United States last spring in Ohio and in weeks had spread to four other states.
abstract: Pig farmers are battling to contain porcine epidemic diarrhea virus, condition that has spread rapidly throughout summer, killing thousands of piglets in 16 states; virus is only deadly to young pigs and is not dangerous to humans, but researchers have not yet been able to determine its origin or root cause.
lead_paragraph: A virus deadly only to young pigs, with no danger for humans, appeared in the United States last spring in Ohio and in weeks had spread to four other states.

headline.main: Hog Farms Battling to Contain Deadly Virus
headline.print_headline: Hog Producers Battling to Contain Virus That Has Killed Piglets by the Thousands
